title: Exploring chora-compose for Inbox Artifact Generation
deliverables: Clarification of chora-compose v1.9.x artifact generation capabilities and current status
Assessment of inbox coordination request generation as a use case (vs SAP regeneration focus)
Guidance on using ConfigLoader and ArtifactComposer APIs if production-ready
Roadmap and timeline for production CLI and artifact generation features
Recommendations on integration approach: wait for chora-compose vs build interim solution
acceptance_criteria: Clear understanding of chora-compose v1.9.x production readiness (CLI availability, core features status)
Assessment addresses whether inbox artifact generation (minimal context → complete JSON) is supported or planned
If supported: Guidance includes working examples of ConfigLoader and ArtifactComposer usage
If not yet ready: Roadmap specifies target version and timeline (e.g., v2.0 in Q2 2025)
Recommendation provides clear path forward with risk assessment
Response addresses post-processing integration needs (ID allocation, event emission, file promotion)

context.background:
chora-base completed a 4-week pilot (Weeks 1-4) evaluating chora-compose for SAP-001 Inbox Coordination Protocol artifact generation. The pilot successfully validated the design approach, achieving 94.9% quality score (target: ≥80%) with complete validation infrastructure (post-processing scripts, quality evaluation, JSON schemas, BDD scenarios).

Week 5 investigation revealed: (1) chora-compose v1.9.1 is installed but CLI is not available, (2) archived documentation describes the architecture (ConfigLoader, ArtifactComposer) but appears to be implementation/development guides rather than user guides, (3) v1.9.0 release focuses on stigmergic context links and SAP regeneration rather than inbox artifact generation.

We designed 15 content configs and 1 artifact assembly config following patterns from chora-compose documentation. However, we need clarification on current production status and whether inbox artifact generation is a supported use case before proceeding with integration.
context.rationale:
We have three paths forward: (A) integrate with chora-compose as-is by building from source, (B) build interim solution and migrate to chora-compose when production-ready, or (C) build standalone generator and preserve future migration path. Path A assumes chora-compose is ready for our use case. Path B assumes clear timeline exists. Path C assumes chora-compose timeline is uncertain or use case unsupported.

Without clarity on chora-compose status and roadmap, we risk either (1) building on an unstable foundation if we integrate prematurely, or (2) building redundant infrastructure if chora-compose will support our use case within 3-6 months. This coordination request aims to gather information needed to make an informed path decision.
context.not_requesting: We are NOT requesting chora-compose implement inbox artifact generation if it's not on the roadmap. We are NOT asking for priority treatment or urgent timeline changes. We are NOT expecting chora-compose to modify its architecture to fit our specific use case. This is purely exploratory to understand what's possible and what timeline to expect.

Production Readiness: Is chora-compose v1.9.x considered production-ready for artifact generation use cases?
Why is the CLI (`chora-compose` command) not available despite package installation?
Are the archived user docs (ConfigLoader, ArtifactComposer API examples) accurate for v1.9.x?
What's the recommended way to use chora-compose: CLI, Python API, or MCP server?
Use Case Fit: Does chora-compose support generating artifacts from minimal context (5-10 input fields → 18-field JSON)?
Is the primary focus SAP regeneration (stigmergic links, freshness tracking) or also new artifact creation?
Can content configs specify AI-augmented generation (e.g., generate 200-400 word background from purpose field)?
Are conditional field inclusion rules supported (e.g., include 'questions' only if request_type == 'exploratory')?
Post-Processing Integration: Does chora-compose support post-generation hooks or plugins?
Can we integrate custom post-processing (ID allocation from sequence files, event emission to JSONL)?
Is there a validation framework for generated artifacts, or should we bring our own?
How does chora-compose handle artifact promotion from draft to final directories?
Timeline and Roadmap: What version will have production-ready CLI and artifact generation?
Is there a target release date for production artifact generation features?
Are there breaking changes expected between v1.9.x and v2.0?
Would you recommend waiting for chora-compose or building interim solution now?

collaboration_modes: Deep Exploration: Joint session reviewing chora-compose architecture, walking through our pilot configs, and determining integration feasibility. Includes working code examples and testing. Estimated effort: 3-4 hours.
Technical Consultation: Async discussion via GitHub issues or coordination channels addressing the questions above with specific guidance on API usage and roadmap. Estimated effort: 1.5-2 hours.
Quick Assessment: Brief review of our use case with high-level recommendation (integrate now, wait for vX.X, or build standalone). Estimated effort: 30-60 minutes.

related.description: v1.9.0 capabilities update focused on stigmergic context links for SAP regeneration
Pilot results (94.9% quality) validating the design approach for inbox generation
Decision document awaiting chora-compose team input to finalize path choice
